intro: Goniothalamus longistipites, commonly known as the long-stemmed goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant belonging to the family Annonaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically arranged in clusters, and it produces fruit that is generally smooth and fleshy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its native range.
